oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Synthesis of bis- and trisoxazole derivatives via Suzuki-Miyaura cross-coupling reaction and van Leusen oxazole synthesis
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KOTHA, S
SHAH, VR
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: alpha-metalated isocyanides
streptomyces-sp
metabolites
annuloline
esters
agents
bisoxazole
suzuki-miyaura cross-coupling
trisoxazole
tosmic
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Both C-2- and C-3-symmetric oxazole derivatives are synthesized via the Suzuki-Miyaura cross-coupling and van Leusen oxazole synthesis. Here, bis- and triscarboxaldehydes were obtained via the Suzuki-Miyaura cross-coupling and further treated with p-toluenesulfonylmethyl isocyanide (TosMIC) in the presence of potassium carbonate as a base and methanol as a solvent to deliver the corresponding oxazole derivatives.
